summary: This is a property deed and associated transfer documents recording the sale of a Manhattan townhouse at 9 East 71st Street from Nine East 71st Street Corporation to Maple, Inc. for a nominal sum of $10.00. Jeffrey Epstein is identified as the President of the seller corporation and signed the deed, transferring the property to a U.S. Virgin Islands corporation.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.role: President of Nine East 71st Street Corporation
persons.context: He is the President of the grantor/seller corporation (Nine East 71st Street Corporation) and personally executed the deed transferring the property to Maple, Inc.

persons.name: Erika Kellerhals
persons.context: She is listed as the buyer's attorney (for Maple, Inc.) and is the agent for Stewart Title who presented the documents. Her name appears on the certification and as a notary public.

connections.description: Kellerhals acted as the attorney for the buyer (Maple, Inc.) in a property transaction where Epstein, as President of the seller corporation, executed the deed.
Epstein is identified as the President of Nine East 71st Street Corporation, the entity selling the property.

events.title: Property Sale of 9 East 71st Street
events.description: Nine East 71st Street Corporation sold the property at 9 East 71st Street, Manhattan, to Maple, Inc. for $10.00 and other consideration.

events.title: Deed Recording
events.description: The deed and associated transfer documents were recorded/filed with the NYC City Register's office.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, Manhattan, New York, NY 10065
St. Thomas, VI 00802, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein, as President of Nine East 71st Street Corporation, executed a deed selling the Manhattan townhouse at 9 East 71st Street to Maple, Inc., a U.S. Virgin Islands corporation.
The sale price listed on the deed is a nominal $10.00 and 'other good and valuable consideration'.
The property transfer involved complex corporate structures, moving the asset from a New York corporation to an offshore entity in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
Attorney Erika Kellerhals represented the buyer, Maple, Inc., and acted as the agent for Stewart Title in the transaction.
The document includes notarized signatures from the U.S. Virgin Islands, indicating the transaction was executed there.
